name: georgian
content:
Georgian adjective
(HISTORICAL PERIOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the period of British history during the rules of Kings George I, II, III, and IV, from 1714 to 1830: Georgian furniture/architecture
relating to the period of British history during the rules of Kings George V and VI, from 1910 to 1952 Compare

Georgian adjective
(GEOGRAPHY)
belonging or relating to the country of Georgia, its people, or its language
belonging or relating to the US state of Georgia or its people: 18,253 Georgian soldiers died in the Civil War. Savannah is a Georgian city known for its historic squares and parks.

Georgian noun
(PERSON)
[ C ] a person from the country of Georgia: He's an ethnic Georgian.
a person from the US state of Georgia: Barrow, a seventh-generation Georgian, graduated from the University of Georgia and Harvard Law School.
More examplesFewer examplesAt the Ajadia Hotel in Tbilisi young Georgians are smoking, drinking and enjoying themselves as they listen to jazz.Georgians are spending less, according to state revenue collection figures.28 percent of Georgians and 32 percent of Mississipians are obese.
